title: Font ID help
content:
Looking for any help with this font

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Untitled-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_116.jpg) | 12.98 KB |
| [thecrossing.PNG](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913/http:/typophile.com/files/thecrossing_0.PNG) | 581.62 KB |
author: tide21

comments.content:
Crossing Creative looks like Gotham. I'll have to dig around for the other.  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_styles.php?productLineID=100008](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_styles.php?productLineID=100008 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_styles.php?productLineID=100008")

Does anyone know the two typefaces (or close facsilimies of) used for "Liberty" and "American Revolution" on the pbs.org website: [http://www.pbs.org/ktca/liberty/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913/http:/www.pbs.org/ktca/liberty/ "http://www.pbs.org/ktca/liberty/")

Many thanks in advance!

Josev, thanks you are right it is Gotham.  
Elizabeth you need to create your own Font ID, read the FAQs for how to do this.
This is not Gotham. It's [Nexa](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913/http:/fontfabric.com/nexa-font) and for both samples.

So sorry - I am new to the site - but what an amazing resource!  
have scoured the FAQ page - cannot find the "how to create a font ID" instructions...any clues on how to proceed appreciated...

[http://www.pbs.org/ktca/liberty/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913/http:/www.pbs.org/ktca/liberty/ "http://www.pbs.org/ktca/liberty/")
ahh, I guess you're right. Nexa is so close to Gotham (at least in the first sample) it must have been inspired by it

Elizabeth,  
first click on the upper right corner on "Type ID Board"  
and then click on "Post New Forum Topic",  
see the image bellow:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018023913im_/http:/typophile.com/files/newtopic_6729.gif)
